results.title: What makes day and night
results.brief_description: This is one of a series of films designed for elementary school science classes; it demonstrates that the alternation of night and day is due to rotation of the earth and not to the apparent motion of the sun around the earth. Two children and their father discuss the cause of night and day using a torch and a light globe to demonstrates the principles involved.

results.title: What little girls are made of (TEFC)
results.brief_description: For over a century male scientists have been searching for evidence to demonstrate female inferiority. This program explores this idea and the effect it has had on the relationship between women and science.

results.title: What is this thing called food? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Thomas Tomizawa and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: Examines the use of chemicals in today’s food supply, with narration by Betty Furness. Shows how new food technology has served the consumer but points out a growing concern among scientists as to the possible effects of chemical additives on the human body.

results.title: What is the big complaint?
results.creator_credit: Salvatore Greco and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The difficulty in dialogue when a traveller from Ontario knowing very little French, must ask directions, becomes the core of a pleasant little episode in Quebec. Included are several men on the street’s views about the situation in Quebec.

results.title: What is space?
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Uses helicopters and imaginary trips through the universe to illustrate the vastness of space. Conducts experiments to show the presence of space in liquids and solids close to hand.

results.title: What is PKU?
results.creator_credit: Deptartment of Audio Visual Communications, Glaxo Australia
results.brief_description: PKU is an accumulation of phenylalanine in the blood, which if left unchecked, will cause intellectual disability. Stresses the importance of diet in controlling this disorder.

results.title: What is physical fitness?
results.creator_credit: Eric Horter and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: This film defines fitness and includes footage of high school student in action to demonstrates the five elements that constitute physical fitness: cardio-respiratory endurances, muscles endurance, flexibility and body composition. From the sereis “Fitness for living”.
